name: schnappm
text: A comment left by schnappm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, waddie, gladi8orrex, Thorfinn, kylank, Gabalfa, morypcaina, robbingdog, milkpants, MortisInvictus, d3athcann0n, Prine, jun, aHatOfPig, Ihmgard, mcjuicy, lateadopter, charchar, usversusthem, NumberKillinger, SurelySmack, excusemesenator, I_Love_Kate)

name: heccibiggs
text: A comment left by heccibiggs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by the_voice, waddie, SurelySmack, Valorgigo)

name: i_love_kate
text: That is how I always feared that I would react to the dreadful responsibility of making the first post. Language centre of the brain all failing, hands all flailing at the keyboard in the hopes of somehow conveying my enthusiasm and making use of an amusing irreverancy without sounding too self-possessed.

name: contrasoma
text: I'd like to think that the majority of good folk faced with the problem you describe simply decided that discretion was the better part of valour, saving us all from even more inane first posts than the archives are already besmirched by.

name: jrpigman
text: This is an intelligent post. The best advice one can give for the first post, like the metaphorical meat dildo, is to not break the seal unless it is for something truly gratifying and epic. A tour de force . Failing that, one finds oneself dribbling piss into the urinal of life, and leaving moist the trousers of self respect.

name: jrpigman
text: A comment left by jrpigman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by the_voice, waddie, SurelySmack)

name: diggidy
text:
I had the chance to make the first post once.
My hands started shaking, heart-rate tripled, vision failed...

Long story short, I woke up two weeks later on the coast of Brazil with a tattoo reading "lol, Ray is so funy", and a deep sense of dissatisfaction.

name: whoisspain
text:
Those that make the first post see into a dark city filled with horrific, chittering shapes, far beyond the edge of reason, where eldritch gods lie dreaming of a horrific world where they rule, or at least can get a decent pie and chips.

It is no wonder they who see this go mad, as can be seen by how lame their post is.

name: comrade_tom
text: Common law gilfriend called Mixie at your side...

name: spinynorman
text:
I have only done it once.

I did it in sheer panic and when I was finished I actually left the room. I knew if I sat in a room with a computer I would just hit F5 over and over again, pleading for the approval of people from the internet. I think I skated by with being fairly ignored except for eight people. Whoever they are, may the sun always shine on their children's heads, unless they're really fair-skinned.

name: theguitarhero
text: Check your link, unless that was supposed to be some statement on the first post.

name: spinynorman
text:
Hot damn, what happened.

You know what, screw it.

name: brokeaccount
text: God damn it Norman you just made the internet accuse me of being unable to care for myself due to a weakened condition I am FURIOUS.

name: semiquaver
text:
Here you go, link fixed: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=10052007

It is the basic, top-level comic so you have to click through. It is worth it though because this is probably the most intelligently worded first post in the archives.

name: beansdooma
text: A comment left by beansdooma was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by waddie, mania3, littlefatdog)

name: heccibiggs
text: A comment left by heccibiggs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by randombeing, waddie, littlefatdog)

name: tommycrashwreck
text: That's pretty much my life strategy.

name: margargaret
text:
When it happened to me, I imagined Chris Onstad himself choosing me for the honor of first post. I thought that maybe he had read my posts and was impressed, thought I had potential. He said to himself, "What the hell, I'll give the kid a shot at the limelight".

Then I made an ass of myself.

name: heccibiggs
text:
You got a chubby within a minute of posting this.

margargaret's got a stalker, neener neener neener...

name: i_love_kate
text: The speed with which Margargaret gets chubbies is an embarrassing subject for her, and I don't doubt that she'd thank you not to bring it up.

name: margargaret
text: The people know what it is to be chosen, and the people have spoken.

name: lateadopter
text: You shall all be force-fed from the end of Dr. Skradley's boom-stick.  As shall I, now that I think about it.

name: i_love_kate
text: I used to think Drskradley was cool.

name: dr_strangeglove
text:
one time I snapped and told Skradley to "shut the fuck up."


not my finest hour.

name: ethelthefrog
text: Where is the good doctor?

name: heccibiggs
text: A comment left by heccibiggs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by onesteleft, jun, echidnaboy, Tolth)

name: waddie
text: A comment left by waddie was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hedonismbot, loneal, lateadopter)

name: overmedicated
text:
Waddie is holding your ass.
He may hand it to you eventually.

name: fineoakstructure
text: So, why do you choose to read Achewood via Assetbar, if the audience is so loathsome?

name: theirateturk
text:
I kinda hate everyone here too

:)

name: semiquaver
text:
Do you hate me, Irate Turk?

Do you hate me?

name: theirateturk
text: I hate you so much that I found this post a month after you posted it just to tell you how much you disgust me

name: davey-boy
text: Same reason one might read the Youtube comments to a video featuring a band or singer that they like. Reason may have little to nothing to do with it.

name: theirateturk
text:
Actually, youtube's comments engine is quite possibly the only place online which is worse than assetbar, in terms of functionality. Combine this with the content and it makes posting on youtube a fruitless experience.

Pretty much any comments system based on your posts being rated by all of the posters sucks ass and is shitty.

name: theirateturk
text: Because it considers a sunlight dodging, basement dwelling loser equal to someone of my status in society.

name: onepapertiger
text: Hear hear, sir.
Comment left by ______________ ignored.

name: odei
text: You know, I'm kinda glad youtube's comment system is almost impossible to use.

name: daidai
text:
Youtube comments can be entertaining.

But the gladi8orrex kind of entertaining, minus the occasional puzzle and quip about a lack of trustworthiness from the chick from Sideways.

For instance, on "Zombie Kid Likes Turtles", there is a comment (the username of which I absolutely refuse to look up among 200,000 comments) stating:


"lol why tutles thats not what the she askd ha"


Comments like that get me every time.

name: semiquaver
text: Frankly, it's close, but AB's fucked-up inbox system puts it below even Youtube.  What the hell kind of bulletin board doesn't provide, oh, an EFFECTIVE WAY TO CARRY OUT A CONVERSATION?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Davey-boy: eh, not really. When I go to youtube, it's default is that the text comments are viewable; it's a little more tempting too look at them.

If you got to achewood.com, you just get the strip. Waddie apparently has made the effort to not only look at the discussions, but also made an account so that he could participate, if mostly through lames (as far as we can tell).

It's pretty easy to avoid Assetbar and still read Achewood, so I'm wondering why a guy who doesn't act overtly troll-ish is going through so much trouble for something he seemingly doesn't like.

I don't buy his reasoning (as it currently stands), and I think heccibiggs was perfectly justified in calling him out.

name: aperson
text: Personally, I come here to read the comments made by pompous asses.

name: hedonismbot
text: You're welcome

name: ford
text:
Sometimes you've gotta know just who it is you're hanging around with. It's like " Is this a cool thing? Do cool people like it? "

No matter how much you love a band, you will spend some time checking out the audience when you see them live.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: like Spinal Tap doesn't.

name: hedonismbot
text:
Are you laming her hoping that people will start to post about the strip? That is wishful thinking. That is a pipe dream. First off, you can't herd cats into focusing on that sort of thing on the internet. Second, at this point most of the posters are here to chat with the community, not to talk about the strip. The strip is an icebreaker, most people here just want to chat with each other. Finally, I'm going to get lamed to hell for this, but there generally isn't that much to say about strips. A few insightful comments (like, 3), a ton of people saying how cool a character or saying is (like 15), and a brick of people guessing about hidden meaning and future storyline (like, 10). If we all stayed on topic, there would be even less signal to the noise, and far fewer comments.

We've got a good community here, few trolls, well defined personalities and/or characters, and skilled writers. I personally wouldn't throw around my lames to punish people like Hecci for doing nothing harmful at all. Hell, some of the better comments have come from bitching at a first-poster (Note: this is rare, usually whining about it just encourages it).

name: margargaret
text: YES

name: lawbot
text: WATCH IT LOVE

name: margargaret
text: NO

name: onepapertiger
text:
I don't want to draw attention to myself by congratulation (untrue), but hedonismbot just said it all, everybody.

or, as Bam Margerargaret said,

YES

name: i_love_kate
text:
You gonna have yourself one hell of a job if you consider the laming of every non-Achewood related comment on Assetbar your right and responsibility.

Also: "I think posting comments merely so people can reciprocate is precisely the kind of attitude that leads to so many lame comments."

Sorry to burst your optimistic little bubble, there, but that's the only reason anyone ever comments on anything. The strip itself does not beg some kind of answer or response, and its perfectly easy to have an opinion on the strip without feeling that a verbalisation of your feelings is also necessitated. Being that the first post on every strip logically precedes any point made by others, in making it the poster is only ever looking to gain some kind of reaction, positive or negative, from the other denizens of Assetbar.

I'm too tired to read through that again and see if it's overly pedantic. You be the judge.

name: i_love_kate
text:
A couple seconds slower than Hedonismbot's, and a few grades less insightful.

But who has the better Futurama avatar?

name: dr_strangeglove
text: you do, frynapple!

name: hedonismbot
text: Your's is animated, so you win.  However, because it has nothing to do with your name, you don't win the Golden Smelloscope award.  You will receive the Tungsten Fing-Longener, which is a lesser prize, with double prize money.

name: davey-boy
text: I don't know, they are very good hands.

name: i_love_kate
text: Great Shatner's ghost! Overwhelmed by references!

name: pogo
text: How can you tell you lames you?

name: pogo
text: Shit, "who lames you"

name: lawbot
text: If the number of lames on a comment exceeds your lame threshold, it gets replaced with a thing telling you who lamed it. You can adjust your lame threshold.

name: i_love_kate
text: I thought I was so clever when I figured that out.

name: pogo
text:
Thanks, and I assume the same goes for chubbies?

(I've had my lame threshold set way high for so long, I forgot about it.)

name: theirateturk
text: No, the same does not go for chubbies you fucking imbecile.

name: thorfinn
text: no, there is no way to find out who chubbied you, which prevents stat-padding, as you can't just get a group of people together and chubby each other like mad.

name: pogo
text: But the gays get to chubby each other like mad, how come Assetbarbarians can't?

name: i_love_kate
text: Stairwells!

name: speccer
text: A bit off-topic, but how does one go about seeing exactly who chubbies and lames your posts?

name: pogo
text: Careful, theirateturk will call you an imbecile.

name: theirateturk
text: Actually, I would have lamed him and said something along the lines that his lame post would probably inform him who lamed his lame post, but I never lame anyone so I did not.

name: speccer
text: Oh, my. I completely deserved that lame for not reading far enough into the thread.

name: schnappm
text: this is pretty much what happened

name: greenkoolayd
text: its like wheel of fortune.  you can sit there on your couch and solve all the puzzles like a motherfucker, but the day youre on stage, theres a good chance youll be all sweating and nervous and stuttering and shit.

name: theirateturk
text: Chubby for you, good sir!

name: blastradius
text: The dude can take to the pavement twelve men on his way to the Crate & Barrel, but is stopped dead in his tracks by a wee register girl. Ramses Luther is of old ways. Of chivalrous ways.

name: pyromancer
text: Thanks for the first post that the hell has anything to do with the strip!

name: hamscout
text:
....Aaand then you ruined it by posting about posting.

YOU'RE BREAKING THE FOURTH WALL!
YOU'RE BREAKING THE FOURTH WALL!

name: ihmgard
text: I gave you a lame, once I started to consider your position I realized I should not have been so quick to lame. I am sorry schnappm

name: theirateturk
text: Perhaps you will also tell us what you had for breakfast. YOU INANE MAN YOU.

name: talix18
text: Tonight is retro-hat-giveaway night at the Yard.  It's not quite as awesome as the one in your icon, but it's not bad.  A chubby for your old school cap.

name: excusemesenator
text: Ah, the staff of life. Always liked that expression. I'm glad Achewood uses it.

name: mattfish
text: Yes, sahrr.

name: tibcoolbreeze
text:
Ramses hasn't invented his own expression for bread?

This just stinks of compromise.

name: excusemesenator
text: Ray's used it before, during the BADASS GAMES.

name: i_love_kate
text: There's a pub near where I live called the Staff of Life. It's sign features a sliced wholegrain loaf. If I'm not mistaken, it's a common, if archaic, expression referring to bread.

name: thorfinn
text: In Jonathan Swift's "Tale of a Tub"(1704), it was mentioned that "bread is the staff of life".  I don't know if this is the first recorded use of the term, but it's the oldest I know of.  It sounds like it could be a biblical term, but I can't find it anywhere on wikipedia, so I'm assuming not.

name: theguitarhero
text:
I think it's called such actually in the Bible.

not sure though.

name: mikossuave
text:
The biblical phrase is "staff of bread," meaning the supply of bread. God tends to use this phrase when he's threatening people. With death. This is, I think, where the idea of bread as the staff (support, supply) of life comes from.

Leviticus 26:26
Ezekiel 4:16
Ezekiel 5:16
Ezekiel 14:13

King James Version, of course.

name: lawbot
text: What about better versions?

name: lawbot
text: All those verses say "staff of bread," not "staff of life." (KJV)

name: lawbot
text: Indeed biblegateway.com cannot find the phrase "staff of life" in any translation.

name: loneal
text: Well, I suppose that's why mikossuave said that all those verses say "staff of bread" and not "staff of life."

name: lawbot
text: You make an interesting and powerful point.

name: kamet
text: He just wanted to hear it from you.

name: kickstart
text: in the Bible, bread is made of delicious Jesus

name: thorfinn
text:
I am filled with immense trepidation
When I think of transsubstantiation
For what if the crackers
Are part of god's knackers?
Is that gay, messianic fellation?

name: achilleselbow
text:
"They smell like come," said Simone, sniffing the unleavened wafers.
"Precisely," continued Sir Edmond. "The hosts, as you see, are nothing other than Christ's sperm in the form of small white biscuits. And as for the wine they put in the chalice, the ecclesiastics say it is the blood of Christ, but they are obviously mistaken. If they really thought it was the blood, they would use red wine, but since they employ only white wine, they are showing that at the bottom of their hearts they are quite aware that this is urine."
The lucidity of this logic was so convincing that Simone and I required no further explanation.

name: pogo
text: Express to Hell, this way!

name: lawbot
text: NO

name: mikossuave
text:
If Jesus is the "bread of life" (John 6:35 [KJV]) and Bread is the "staff of bread" (as has been proven)then Jesus must be the Staff of Life. Which means that Ramses is upset that the mixer is not powerful enough to pummel Jesus into a doughy, bakeable mixture.

Everything is clear to me now.

name: i_love_kate
text: That's pretty much the only thing that anyone needs to know about Christianity.

name: contrasoma
text: Hardly.  Such affectations stink of modern-day pretension.  Ramses has no need of faddish beatnik slanging.

name: maximus
text: Congealed beer?

name: mcphercj
text:
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuad61vvj
True. True.

name: download-this
text: Careful Ramses, you gonna tap a hole right through that there sheet o' paper.

name: bakerton
text: It's nice to see dialog from two characters we don't see that often.

name: dapooka
text:
Those who have memorized the archive, please correct me: I think we've actually seen Ramses once - though heard about him many times.

Molly's father though - have we ever seen him before these last two strips?

text: Yeah, in Beef's dream.

name: gormster
text: (PS link )

name: dapooka

name: tekende
text: One should not merely sit in the presence of such badass-ness, dapooka. Such a thing is not Done.

name: dapooka
text:
I sit (or stand, or sit...damn) corrected.

I'm just royally screwed here, no matter what I do now, no matter what badass-ness I am presented with. Damn sit-down jobs.

Thanks though for the advice, tekende!

name: brokeaccount
text: I am expecting Ramses' meeting with Showbiz not to go down terribly well.

name: the_voice
text:
I suspect that Ramses will probably have to hush Showbiz.

With violence.

name: em2
text: They do not know each other, yet they already have a relationship. A death relationship.

name: the_voice
text:
There is a certain feeling you get when you know someone is right about a death relationship.

It is a feeling in the spine .

jesus god a Death Relationship has begun.

name: ford
text: People keep saying that showbiz is gonna get his ass kicked. Personally I don't see it going any farther than "hush young man" and then showbiz avoids speaking at all for the rest of the evening by hiding in the closet.

name: invidious
text: Maybe it's just me, but I'm pretty sure Ramses could frown Showbiz to death.

name: daidai
text:
Roast Beef could lock his door Showbiz to death.

No charity = another starved, dead cat rotting across the street from a house in California.

name: pogo
text: Hey, you've just come up with a cure for homelessness.  Stop feeding 'em for a week!  Brilliant.

name: comrade_tom
text: Quick! to the callousdisregardmobile!

name: irondave
text: I will follow on The Bike of Modest Proposals.

name: irondave
text: It is a very Swift Bike.

name: stereo
text: Apparently it also Bears Explanations.

name: bondijames
text: Really they should stop messing around at Crate & Barrel and head on over to Williams Sonoma for the 620, which also comes with the 11-tine wire whisk...if you're going to make the staff of life, you ought to be able to make the souffle of life as well.

name: axhoola
text: Someday, I hope to attain the level of a Serious Man of Bread.

name: whoisspain
text:
It's good. You get all the yeast you want from the local community, though you have to solve all their bread, and bread product, related problems.

These happen more often than you would think. Last week I had to stab a man in the face with a freshly baked, razor-sharp baguette because he was insulting a lady's croissants without due cause. The last thing he smelled was delicious french bread as it rammed through his eyeball and went directly through his skull.

Bread is complicated , kids.

name: cromar
text: Bread is not like this at all.  Bread is for love and satiation.  It is the staff of life, not death!

name: whoisspain
text: Normally it is, man, normally it is. But sometimes a man has to take a stand when someone's bread products are being unfairly slated. And sometimes it means a man goes down the hard way, pain au pain .

name: davey-boy
text: Alright, that was cute.

name: woodjay
text: whoa, I fear what would happen if the man with blood on his hands were to compete against a certain old bear in the second round of the badass games.

name: heccibiggs
text: That shit would be awesome.

name: invidious
text: My memory isn't what it used to be, but I think the entire Earth was destroyed.

name: i_love_kate
text: Interesting, if true.

name: tommycrashwreck

Fry's voice improves all your comments.

Does anyone else have an unshakeable tendency to read comments in the voice of the avatar?

weeeee're the young ones

name: contrasoma
text: Any organized competition would swiftly be forsaken for a long and honest conversation about various bourbons and soil.  Men as badass as these don't needlessly try to outdo their brethren in arbitrary contests just because a lesser man slips an invitation under their door.

name: redface
text: the universe would probably collapse in on itself; Unable to contain the badassery of the spectacle.

name: kickstart
text:
Faked Out! I thought the other shadowy shadow was Molly's mom, not dad.

name: talix18

name: hamscout
text:
Nooooooo!
The alt-text attempts an accent, and falls victim to... AssetBarf!
[IMGS OFF]

name: echidnaboy
text: Man, the alt text can't even produce the e-acute in "Teodor". Comes out lookin' like Tacodor. Never seen it stumble over such as a humble apostrophe, though. Maybe Onstad cut-and-pasted from Word? Such a fate has befallen many an unwary AssetBarbarian.

name: contrasoma
text: Tacodor is one of the more disappointing fiesta names the spinner can impose.

name: postblank
text:
Bastardizing the bastardized, Tacodome would be a neat name for one of those semi-legitimate Mexican restaurants**

Tacodome: Two Men Enter, Three Men Leave

**You know the type of Mexican food joint. It's not a chain, but there's white people working there almost 1:1 with the Mexican folk for some unknown reason. The food is slightly below average and the frozen margaritas are too expensive, but you keep going there because the food is cheap.

name: terebikun
text: I think the world's ready for a character named Tacodor.

name: terebikun
text: He could be like a Mexican barbarian.

name: comrade_tom
text: Tacodor what news from the cimmerian plains?

name: comrade_tom
text: Que?

name: dr_strangeglove
text: my pal Ben came up with a character called "The Indie Cholo." All it consists of is Ben putting on his best Latino accent and asking me, "Ey fool, ju like Built to Spill?"

name: whoisspain
text: [b]Hispanic Hipsters[b] cover story: "Why "The Indie Cholo" Is Our Mortal Enemy"

name: whoisspain
text: Curse you BBcode. CURSE YOU!

text: I think someone needs a better operating system.  Looks fine to me.

text: So did they each figure out who the other was already?  "these kids" makes it sound like maybe they did.

name: edwell
text: But "in my case" suggests they haven't.

name: kickstart
text: yeah, I saw that right after I posted (like a ninny)

name: postblank
text: I'm liking the personality traits that Ramses is now showing he has passed on to Ray.  Willingly going overboard on a gift purchase without a thought to the added expense, and standing around with some old knucklehead hella yellin' about the dough.

name: autrepoupee
text:
also, the whole having a really strong opinion about an appliance most people shrug at, getting angry at Roast Beef for being poor and self-effacing, and and the phrase "amateur hour".

is so ray

name: stereo
text: is so is so Vlad

name: dapooka
text: It's really hilarious to me that the exact moment I'm posting on the day before - whining that Onstad hasn't updated, he updates.

name: edwell
text:
[IMGS OFF]

N.B. "Man" here denotes man in the aggregate, and not Peter Griffin.

name: pogo
text: Age check:  Yes, I know Meatwad very well, but haven't hooked up with Robochicken yet.

name: thorfinn
text: They're both from ATHF, you just need to watch it more often.

name: hedonismbot
text: Note:  Do not do this.  The hours of lame are not worth the content of awesome.  I hope you have better things to do in your waning years.

name: fineoakstructure
text: I can't say I agree with this, despite how bad the last dozen episodes have been, but still, pogo: if there's one episode of ATHF worth seeing it's the Cybernetic Ghost of Christmas Past from the Future episode.

name: hedonismbot
text: I will agree that there is some primo stuff in there, but when you only have a few more months to live, there are better shows to be watching.  Absorb and savor the full meat of Futurama for instance, or Boondocks.

name: the_rich
text: Futurama is way hella better then that Simpsons junk or any other cartoon ever created. It actually has a plot and character arcs. Boondocks I'm impartial to since it revolves around race jokes and as a black man I don't find too funny any more, except for the R. Kelly episode.

name: chachibenji
text:
R. Kelley just got acquitted of EVERYTHING.
Boondocks is like the psychic social commentary for black celebrities.

name: chachibenji
text: Kelly* oh man what have I done

name: postblank
text:
I'd have to counter that McGruder takes a more unique approach to "racial"** commentary than most these days. Racial humor thanks to retards like Mencia and Chappelle has literally become, "White people do this, Black people do this ." But I think the Boondocks uses this device to satirize itself. I think more people would see this without contrast characters like Ruckus and the elder Wuncler. But without the elder Wuncler, we don't get Ed jr and his Samuel L-voiced comrade.

**Far as I'm concerned, race is a social construct.

name: pogo
text: Since my time is short, I will get the DVDs so I can FF the lame stuff.

name: maximus
text: I personally feel that if the entirety of Adult Awim were launched into space along with a couple million lawyers and telemarketers the world would be a MUCH better place.

name: atticusonline
text: Hedonsimbot implies that pogo is so old he only has a few more months to live.

name: kamet
text: Edwell... I... I... I love you.

name: cleave
text: But where's the Alt-Text? =( <--(that emote face shows "how I feel right now")

name: gladi8orrex
text: A comment left by gladi8orrex was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by InspectorGadget, frijole, Lumus, charchar, tellumo)

name: anitrophaeron
text: Careful with card-trick-type-antics.  They will get you fired for wizardry if you are a teacher in Florida.

name: autrepoupee
text: but that guy WAS a wizard!

name: comrade_tom
text:
my teacher once put on his wizard hat and robes.

It led to a huge courtcase and years of therapy.

name: heccibiggs
text: Usually I can come somewhere near to understanding your posts. NOT THIS TIME.

name: echidnaboy
text: "Lots of love. So, the Pharaoh is talking to the Irishman and they have several small [?] concerns as they are both old and indubitably all-or-nothing type dudes with a healthy irreverence toward organised religion."

name: margargaret
text:
I read it as "similar concerns".

Also, they have mad lols?

name: tekende
text: I believe it is "similar concerns," not "small." Either that or Ghostbusters is somehow involved in the comment in question.

name: echidnaboy
text: "Similar", yes. I feel like we're getting somewhere here. Soon we will crack his code and discover his true identity (my money's on Jason Todd, everyone turns out to be Jason Todd eventually)

name: tekende
text:
Hilarious!

I hate Jason Todd. Or really DC's handling of him in the last few years.

name: synapse
text: LOL means Laugh Out Loud. At least here on Earth.

name: speccer
text: I'm pretty sure it's not "with a healthy irreverence toward organised religion", but rather "but, whilst in the throes of anger, made fools of themselves in the presence of a store clerk".

name: echidnaboy
text: I'm pretty sure you and Synapse are missing the joke.

name: comrade_tom
text:
As the pharoah said to the irishman

god i wish that was the start of a common off colour Joke...

name: tekende
text: Sounds more like a Paul Simon song.

name: comrade_tom
text: probably be a B side and all...

name: echidnaboy
text:
Or Bob Dylan:

There's too much confusion / I can't get no relief dough hook

name: echidnaboy
text: NO

name: eatmorekix
text: nobody seems to have gotten your joke there.

name: flazisismuss
text: Does Molly's dad look like the guy on the Beefeater gin bottle or am I just thirsty?

name: comrade_tom
text:
Beefeater Gin? I remeber seeing a gordons bottle of old with a beefeater on, is Beefeater a brand in itself?

I'm mainly a Gordons or Bombay saphire chap myself

name: flazisismuss
text: It's OK for a cheap gin.  I got some last time I went to the store since they were out of both Junipero and Hendrick's.  Bastards.  Beefeater suffices for gin and tonics.

name: comrade_tom
text: Interesting stuff, a Gin and tonics quality usually increases with the length and strenuousness of the day that proceeded it.

name: thorfinn
text: For cheap gin, I've found a brand called New Amsterdam that is quite nice.  Not my favorite gin by a longshot, but it's $13 a bottle, smooth enough to drink on the rocks, and makes a passable martini.  In comparison with other spirits, I'd put it on par with Jim Beam bourbon, Christian Brothers brandy, or Charles Shaw wine, a far cry from the best, but far better than anything else you can get in its price range.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Thank you, I have just written all of that down.

I am so ready for university.

name: thorfinn
text: Everything there is available in most liquor stores, except Charles Shaw wine, often referred to as "Three Buck Chuck", which is only available at Trader Joe's stores due to some sort of deal they have with the winery that makes it.  It's $3 a bottle and tastes better than most wines I've had in the <$15 price range.  I have, however, only drank the Shiraz and the Cabernet, so I don't know how any of the others are.

name: margargaret
text: That makes me really wish there was a Trader Joe's here. I spend way too much of my money on terrible cheap wine.

name: flazisismuss
text: It is actually two bucks, and it's not very good.  I might use it to cook with, but not to drink.  Everything else at TJ's rocks.

name: thorfinn
text: It's two bucks in California, three bucks everywhere else because there's extra tax when it leaves the state.

name: pogo
text: The chardonnay is insipid.

name: hedonismbot
text: If you want something completely palatable, and less than ten bucks, go Bogle.  I've had Chuck, and didn't go too wild about her.  Bogle Merlot and Bogle Chard are quite nice, and 8 or 9 bucks at most places.

name: pogo
text: Thanks, but my main drug is Reisling, and the Deutsch crank it out cheap.  (As do many others.)

name: tommycrashwreck
text: And I've said it before but I swear Ramses is just a cat version of Tom Waits

name: echidnaboy
text: Exhibit A

name: achilleselbow
text: I don't listen to him, but he was pretty sweet in Wristcutters .

name: tommycrashwreck
text: You should try Alice, Rain Dogs, Bone Machine, or Mule Variations. They're all good places to start.

name: rene
text:
That dog was never meant to be leashed!


He was BEGGING for it!

name: orvel
text:
How did the Magi find the Christ child in the manger?

How indeed.

text: Muttonchops AND unibrow. Wow

text: Never mind, I

text: My father was a beekeeper. His father before him was a beekeeper. And I; I wish to follow in their footsteps..

name: dezufnocosem
text: He's full of bees!

name: theguitarhero
text: Killing me won't bring back your goddamn BEES!

name: davey-boy
text: Argh! Not the Bees! Argh! They are in my EYES!

sleepchillin
text: ah, fuck. i'm too sick to do anything right apparently. just go here: http://www.gimmickwear.com/designs/ntb/ntb2001main.jpg

name: usversusthem
text: Gay beard, I guess. You know, like Jennifer Lopez is one.

name: kickstart
text: Fun LGBT fact: the male equivalent is a "purse"

name: xi
text: Huh. I did not know that. The more I know. (do dodo do)

name: quantumcasaba
text: Ramses is sheepish about the dough hook incident..

name: deovalente
text: I want to see Ray's Daddy punch things now.

name: rude_mechanical
text: I want sideburns like that :(

name: hateandwar
text:
So how did Ramses get invited to the wedding anyways? He's not related to Beef or Molly, and I didn't think anybody knew any way of contacting him.

Probably just a "He comes to you" sort of thing then.

name: weapon86
text:
Chubbied for the use of Space Moose.

As Ray is Roast Beef's best man, and the three of them are alumni of the G.O.F, it only seems fitting.

Ramses comes to you with KitchenAid in hand, but his goodbye is his greatest gift. Classic practitioner of the goodbye style, that Ramses.

name: ford
text: Speaking of goodbyes, I wonder if we're gonna hear from Dornheim before all this is over.

name: harleyb
text: Apparently the 8-cup KitchenAid actually DOES come with the dough-hook: http://www.kitchenaid.com/catalog/product.jsp?src=Stand Mixers&cat=310&prod=349

name: ummagumma
text:
I'm glad I'm not the only one who was prompted to research the KitchenAid model lineup.

Perhaps they don't consider the 8-cup's basic 'C' design to be a real dough hook. The Pro 600-series has a "Burnished PowerKnead Spiral Hook", which sounds like something they'd prefer.

name: featurelessvoid
text: The Burnished PowerKnead Spiral was one of the first takedown moves that Ramses used in the Great Outdoor Fight.  To this day, the Ruling Body still refuses to talk about it, but Fight historians agree that old Stumpy McGee was just asking for it.

name: phy
text: Isn't that the move Tiger Mask used to defeat Great Muta?

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I would be curious to see if we learn any of Molly's backstory (I forget the date of that psuedo-strip) but that doesn't seem likely given the time constraints.
Also, where is the gypsy family going to stay for three weeks? With Beef, Molly, and Showbiz?
Still in Ray's pool shed? With Ray and Ramses?

Holy shit.

name: invidious
text: All in favor of an Achewood spin-off comic featuring nothing but the Adventures of Ramses Luther Smuckles?  Aye.

name: hateandwar
text: Be kind of redundant. Ramses sees some fools, corrects their behavior, repeat. I guess the innovation would have to come from the manner in which he corrected them, finding new and fanciful ways to beat asses. Tear a man in half. Turn him into a marrionette with the man's own detatched tendons.

name: heccibiggs
text: It would be like if the Queen woke you up every morning. Too Special.

name: tekende
text: I initially read this without the "the," which brought to me the idea of the band Queen waking me up, perhaps by rocking "Fat-Bottomed Girls" or "Bohemian Rhapsody." Delightful.

name: heccibiggs
text: Bahaha. It's probably because I capitalised "Queen". In my defence, I was just going for full strip-accuracy.

name: i_love_kate
text: And quite terrifying, seeing as Freddy Mercury's dead and all.

name: woodenteeth
text: Oooooohhhh Fat Bottomed - BRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAINS!

name: i_love_kate
text: If no-one else has replied to this by tomorrow, I'm going to write a full set of lyrics to Bohemian Rhapsody, altered for an undead audience.

name: tekende
text:
Mamaaaaa
Undeath had just begun...

name: tekende
text:
Oh! Oh!

Mama, just ate a man
Put my teeth against his head
Ate his brain and now he's dead...

name: comrade_tom
text: Scaramoush Scaramoush! can you do the fandango?

name: margargaret
text: RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!! (translation: Scary scary lightning, very very frightening.)

name: margargaret
text: Okay, so apparently I have been singing this song wrong my entire life. I'll just go back to lurking now because I am a silly fool

name: woodenteeth
text: Maaamaaaa his life was very yum...

name: tekende
text:
Okay, screw posting little snippets, I'm gonna do the whole thing. Feel free to do your own version, i_love_kate.

Is this the real death-
Is this just fantasy-
Rose from a graveyard-
No escape from reality-
Open your eyes
Look up to the skies and see-
I'm just a zombie, I need no sympathy-
Because I'm easy come, easy go,
A little high, little low,
Anyway the wind blows, doesn't really matter to me,
To me

Mama, just ate a man,
Put my teeth against his head,
Ate his brain, now he's dead,
Mama, undeath had just begun,
But there's no way to throw it all away-
Mama ooo,
Didn't mean to make you die-
If I'm still walking dead this time tomorrow-
Carry on, carry on, because nothing really matters-

Too late, my time has come,
Sends shivers down my spine-
Body's numb all the time,
Goodbye everybody-I've got to go-
Gotta leave you all behind and face the truth-
Mama ooo-
I didn't want to die,
I sometimes wish I'd never come back at all-

I see a little silhouetto of a man,
Scaramouche, scaramouche will you do the fandango-
Thunderbolt and lightning-very backlighting me-
Galileo, galileo, Galileo, galileo
Galileo figaro-magnifico-
But I'm just a zombie and nobody loves me-
He's just a zombie, ate his whole family-
Spare him his death from this monstrosity-
Easy come easy go-will you let me die-
Bismillah! no-we will not let you die-let him die-
Bismillah! we will not let you die-let him die
Bismillah! we will not let you die-let me die
Will not let you die-let me die
Will not let you die let me die
No, no, no, no, no, no, no-
Mama mia, mama mia, mama mia let me die-
Beelzebub has a devil put aside for me, for me, for me-

So you think you can bite me and spit in my eye-
So you think you can shoot me and leave me to die-
Oh baby-can't do this to me baby-
Just gotta get out-just gotta get right outta here-

Nothing really matters,
Anyone can see,
Nothing really matters-,nothing really matters anymore

Any way the wind blows....

name: woodenteeth
text: Wow. That looked a far easier fit than I would have imagined. I'm glad I got this started. Oh. Chubby for "very back-lighting me". Gold right there.

name: elscoob
text: Out of Chubbies.  Out.  Of.  Chubbies...!

text: I_love_kate has gotta be pissed, you basically just intercepted his chubby-laden idea.

text: Pissed, with goals.

name: margargaret
text: Only until the coming of Saoshyant, when his soul will be reunited with Ahura Mazda.

text: Damn it. My joke is being slowly buried beneath zombie Queen.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Slowly buried beneath Zombie Queen. That is so metal.

Brutal.

name: phy
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: davey-boy
text: Right! I had heard that Mercury was a Zorastrian somewhere.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Ahura mazda? as in the Zorastarian god?

oh yeah freddie was (in Zadie Smith's words) "that nice persian boy"

name: margargaret
text: His parents were in fact Parsi, which is a Zoroastrian sect in India who's practitioners are descendants of Persian immigrants.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Exactly, i only know this from "White Teeth", but Zoroastrianism is still pretty damn cool whatever sect it is...

Zoroastrians are basically the fun kind of Iranian (if only as they set fire to more shit...)

name: margargaret
text: I like the whole letting your dead be eaten by carrion birds before interment thing.

name: daidai
text:
I like that the prophet's name was Zoroaster. That name. Would be so badass.


I'm officially naming my first children Zoroaster and Mariah.

name: pogo
text: The other kids will call your son "Zoro" and laugh.

text:
like father like son

:(

name: comrade_tom
text:
Hey Zoro! Youre dad was gay for Antonio Banderas!

BURRRRRRRRRRRN!

name: talix18
text: I like that I read that as "letting your dead be eaten by carrion birds before the internet".  As in, posted on YouTube!

name: chachibenji
text: A comment left by chachibenji was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lawbot, heccibiggs, Davey-Boy)

name: whoisspain
text: What if we had something less special, like Michael Fagan waking you up every morning?

name: pogo
text: Wish I had the time to create a link to a scary picture of the Fagan guy from Steely Dan.

name: hedonismbot
text: I'm picturing an image of him waking you in the morning to tell you he has traded you into sexual slavery in exchange for a handful of diamonds

name: daidai
text: No, no. That was Thomas Jefferson.

name: heccibiggs
text: Molly's dad: Tiny dot eyes, or eyes concealed by impressive eyebrows?

name: fablesandblues
text:
Gotta go with the dots. The head-wrinkle flourishes do not help the confusion.

Ramses: Leather wristband, or watch facing inside?

name: hateandwar
text: Dots. Look at panel 4.

name: comrade_tom
text: I'd say expressive over impressive, the dude reminds me of John Stewart Mill, or a simmilar dude of gravity...

name: whoisspain
text: That said, I doubt either of the two above have a Harm Principle. Or at least one that's not about causing harm.

name: comrade_tom
text: hmmm, Ramses seems all about handing deserving chumps their asses, plus he hates being told what to do by suckers without a clue, Mill does condone the use of harm in certain moments, only when neccessary, and i think Ramses could justify most of his beatific beatings.

name: pursesnatcher
text: KISS!! KISS!!

name: tetsujin
text:
[url=http://www.kitchenaid.com/catalog/product.jsp?src=Stand Mixers&cat=310&prod=349]8-cup Kitchenaid[/url]...
"'C' dough hook kneads yeast dough for bread and pizza recipes"

name: tetsujin
text: Thank you, Assetbar...

name: davey-boy
text: Staff of life? Is this a call back to the 'Bad-assed games'?

name: davey-boy
text: GOD DAMN IT! Beaten! I Ctrl-f'ed bad ass, bad assed and bad-ass! How was I suppose to anticipate 'BADASS'?!

name: ortsac
text: amateur hour, is what amounts to

name: irondave
text: This is a good phrase, and it is the way I read the comic at first.  But I look up there now and an "it" is there where I saw none before.  Does anyone else think it may have changed, or are the first glimmers of my dotage upon me?

name: i_love_kate
text:
Panel five is surprising. Ramses' tone, his expression... I think that he falsely claims to be ashamed at having made a fool of himself in front of the store attendant, when in all actuality he fears that further exposure to his dread countenance would cause the poor Janelle to either faint clean away or suffer a cardiac arrest.

Not that she wouldn't deserve it. Janelle. It doesn't even matter that such nomenclature is very unlikely to be her fault.

name: quantumcasaba
text: I can beat the asses of 3,000 men, the hell I care about pestering Janelle!

name: edwell
text:
Look, Todd and Janelle are dicks, but they don't deserve to die!

Well, I guess Todd does.

name: binlaggin
text: Must everyone view Ramses as an unstoppable death machine?  I think it adds a lot more to his character that he has some actual personality traits instead of just maiming every person he meets.

name: whoisspain
text: He is both a gentleman of some style and personality and an unstoppable death machine. I do not see why the two are mutually exclusive.

name: talix18
text: A one-man death machine.  He'll make the city bleed.  (Sorry, I was listening to it yesterday...)

name: binlaggin
text:
I think we agree Mr. whoisspain.

I'm not suggesting that they are mutually exclusive, merely that the other gentleman side exists, and that there is no need to explain this side of his character in relation to the death machine part.

name: deusoma
text: Hey now, no need for that kind of talk. Especially after we allowed Ray's half-brother Dornheim to go on his way without commenting on his name. Not to mention that as names go, this one is about as inoffensive as you can find.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: My girlfriend's name is Janelle!

name: cullers
text:
So I was right a few days ago. Here they claim this item is on the registry and they're looking at the Crate and Barrel registry. According to
http://www.achewood.com/index.php?date=05232008
the bride and groom are registered at Macy's and Templeton Psychiatric Services.

This must merely be a mistake. Because I was convinced that a man like Ramses would not be so crass as to order off the registry. Some commenters disagreed with me, but it is the truth that ordering off the registry is chancy at best despite what idiotic pile of crap cnn might be spewing today.
http://www.cnn.com/2008/LIVING/personal/06/16/gift.pain.wedding/index.html

name: falseprophet
text:
Mistake? Man that is nonsense I am quite certain that this is what Onstad intended to do see man you just ain't smart enough to see all the hidden secret layers of meaning man go back to AP English class fool.

Never fear though for once I complete The Great Achewood SparkNote all fools who do not bow down when I come to they town will know me by the trail of the (un)dead white men that will be put to shame.

All

"An essential contribution to the field of literary criticism. Falseprophet's insights into the work of Onstad raises our cultural awareness to heights that would have blinded us if looked upon without the shaded spectacles of Raymond Smuckles."
- Tom Wolfe

"Damn Chris Onstad I didn't think much of your medium but this here SparkNote is a player. "
- Harold Bloom

"Wow! The Great Achewood SparkNote is totally rockin my can! I never thought it could be like this! "
- Gore Vidal

"man what"
- Michael Chabon

--- Winner of the 2008 Down With The Swirl Literary Prize ---

*~* Black America's feelings on this dissertation are: Pro *~*

name: usversusthem
text:
I used my last chubby on this, homebro. Spend it wisely.

ps: "What can I say about this dissertation that hasn't already been said about Afghanistan? It looks bombed out and depleted."

- Silky Johnson

name: falseprophet
text: Bitch I'm bout to stick my gators up your ass and show your insides some style.

name: daidai
text: Ooh. You must look ridiculous.

name: pravda
text:
"Falseprophet's intimate and yet playful treatment of the almost innaproachably complex Achewood universe has given me a new lease on life. Poetically he breaks down each story arc into a fine mist that swirls and delights in a way only Achewood can. This Great Achewood Sparknote is possibly the greatest thing ever written. Give this man a gold star. GIVE HIM ALL OF THE GOLD STARS."
- a bitter English schoolmarm

name: whoisspain
text: Thanks to my days being taught by bitter Scottish schoolmarms, I now have an irrational fear of chalk dust, gold stars, and vicious beatings.

name: ethelthefrog
text: Ethel's feelings on Falseprophet's face are: Cherish

name: satyr
text: ethelthefrog is down with the Swirl.

name: jerkface
text:
oh! oh! I've always wanted to do this...

TAP TAP

name: flaxplus
text: Daaaaaaaaaaamn, assetbar is giving Firefox 3 the doody pants!

name: woodenteeth
text:
Onstad looks to be getting into the stride of this. The first appearance of two vital characters that haven't really been given much or any dialogue previously and the first conversation is about the compromise involved with different models of Kitchen appliance.

It's not unlike the humour that would be involved in a professional baseball player striking out in a back yard game of T-ball.

name: comrade_tom
text: I read this strip whilst listening to Springsteen after a night of red wine, Cajun chicken and 6 quid Cigars ... overall this was exactly what i needed...

name: tommycrashwreck
text: I'm glad for you! It lightens my heart to know that somewhere, someone is having or has had a good day.

name: pogo
text: Finally, some dudes who are older than moi!

name: comrade_tom
text:
Fact for the day:
Ramses and Pogo have been backgammon buddies since old times.

name: frijole
text: This may be a new litmus test for when I send people to Achewood. The subtle facial emotions giving away the deeper thought given by each character to every line the speak. Such rich talk and propriety over an everyday object. Quality, right here.

name: pygmalion00
text: I wholeheartedly wish either one of these men were my father.

name: theirateturk
text: I'm going to start chubbying the lame first posts in an attempt to be radical.

name: theirateturk
text: [think Professor Chaos]

name: saucy_jack
text: I was chillink earlier and decided to read the Badass Games again... and now "staff of life" comink to haunt me! Is so strange!

name: smilebuddha
text:
What I like is that I actually used the word "sassafras" today in conversation BEFORE this strip was released. However, I used it in terms of showing temper, much like the old timey "rhubarb", and not in terms of silliness

This has been another Achewood moment in diction

name: jimjams
text: What in hell is a KitchenAid?

name: ethelthefrog
text: Oh, you poor, poor man.  You poor, poor boy man.

name: hedonismbot
text: I'm sure if you asked some broad she'd tell you.  A KitchenAid is to women what a heart is to men.

name: phy
text: A KitchenAid is the author of nostalgia of childhood years, of the promise of cookies and the illicit morsels of uncooked dough. Oh, for the taste of those years.

name: someonegreat
text: I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.

name: saulbellow
text:
I love how he effortlessly uses the name "Janelle" in spite of his antiquated brogue.

If you can call that kind of a thing a brogue. I wouldn't know.

name: wonelove
text:
these men have CLASS.
damn.

name: daidai
text:
General Burnsides, get back to your post!

[IMGS OFF]

name: daidai
text: That was bigger than intended...But it makes it all the facialharier.

name: phy
text: The Facialharrier is a beard that can take off and land vertically.

name: echidnaboy
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: thegoblins
text: Man, I don't know much about warfare, but I always thought of generals as free birds, roaming the earth like small gods, only seldom recieving orders from superiors and that too from afar.  But here we see a man with the mane of a lion being ORDERED BACK TO HIS POST.

name: tekende
text: If you watch The Incredible Hulk , you will see that the writer(s) and director have that same idea about generals.

name: randyleepublic
text: I googled "bill of public dowry" and got nada.  Onstad does it again.  Pure authentic invention.  Someday he is going to surprise the hell out of us.  How, with what, is anybody's guess, but I'm thinking great American novel or hit sit-com.

name: theirateturk
text:
One day someone will google "bill of public dowry" and be directed to your post.

And possibly see this one underneath it.

And realise that they have been scooped.

name: pogo
text:
The great dialog might not work as well when spoken. I think reading it lets us absorb it at our own speed.

If a film or sitcom were attempted, I would drop the animation and cast real people.

name: lawbot
text:
Poor show.

I think we're going to have to accept that Onstad's not able any more to produce great material every day.

name: theirateturk
text: UNLIKE YOU

name: lawbot
text: YES

name: woodenteeth
text: Really? Why do you dislike the strip?

name: lawbot
text: It wasn't funny, it didn't really develop the characters, or portray any kind of truth. It was just stereotyical dialogue for one undeveloped character, and an excuse to make fun of welsh accents with the other. All it needed was a sheepsex joke to really show off the lack of creativity, and Onstad's weird lack of familiarity with people who aren't white non-hispanic, male americans.

name: lateadopter
text:
I found it funny that the tough guys didn't have the balls to face the store clerk again. That would count as character development for Ramses, who heretofore has never shown weakness. Also, both of them are somewhat befuddled by the unwritten rules that business has built up around weddings to make you overspend just to avoid embarrassment. Wait, I meant etiquette, which any gentleman knows innately, and the propriety of which no right-thinking person would ever question.

Or, quoting you: NO.

name: hedonismbot
text:
You don't think this displays anything at all new about Ramses? I agree that the sheepfucker is just a foil, but seeing him actually make a mistake, and how he handles it, as well as his recognizing that Beef is cheap, doesn't say anything about his character? Can I run that last sentence on any further?

Seriously, I don't see how you can call his dialogue stereotypical when we have only seen him speak twice before.

name: lawbot
text: Well, he's mostly been referred to by other characters, as a romantic(ised) figure. I don't think we needed a whole cartoon of this dull dialogue, following two strips of him making a mistake, to establish that he is just a man (who is an uncanny fighter).

name: i_love_kate
text: I guess you've been waiting a long time to say something like this, Lawbot, but have patience. Onstad, for the moment, is still good.

name: lawbot
text: No, I've said it before, but this one gave the impression of being phoned in (with accompanying fax of basic drawing).

name: hamscout
text: Wait, some Hispanics can be white ?

name: loneal
text: Yeah, dude, plenty of Hispanics/Latinos are white. The terms have to do with geographical/cultural origin rather than with race. I am part Latina, but I am basically an albino.

name: hedonismbot
text: The giveaway about loneal's Latina heritage is not her skin color, but her 200lb ass.

name: lawbot
text: Contra loneal, the answer is that only in American culture is there a race called "hispanic." In europe those people are white (I'm not talking about spanish people for all etymological geniuses out there).

name: margargaret
text: Hispanic usually means anyone of both Spanish and Native American descent. Although I do know some people who are almost or totally completely white, who still call themselves hispanic because they or their parents are from latin America. It's a complicated term. I tend to think of it as more a culture more than as a race.

name: pogo
text: I prefer "spic."

name: ethelthefrog
text: I really wish assetbar would let me lame you right now, Pogo.  I would lame you so hard.

name: pogo
text: That was a despicable comment, I agree.  Sorry, my Spanish-influenced bretheren.

name: ethelthefrog
text: All is forgiven.

name: spaceseeker51
text: Old school meets old schooling.  Ramses is right thought - the only thing the 8-cup KitchenAid would be good for is mixing up a batch of industrial-strength mashed depression for Roastbeef.

name: tekende
text:
Hey jollysaintpete. Hey, dude, what's up? I notice you've been laming all of my comments. That's fun! Does it make you feel big? Like a strong, powerful man with a long and rigid member? I hope it does, because otherwise, well, it would just be a pointless activity, wouldn't it, buddy?

Yeah, okay, I called you a dick once. Get over it. And anyway, you're kind of proving my point, aren't you? Banning me from #achewood, laming my comments for no reason. These are the actions of a dick, jollysaintpete.

Why don't you get over yourself and realize that a) not everyone is going to like you and b) if you act like a dick, people are going to think you're a dick.

Fuck along, now.
Comment left by ______________ ignored.

name: loneal
text:
It is okay, Tekende, we do not think any less of you for those little solitary lames on your posts. I hadn't looked at who made them, but I was definitely rolling my eyes, going, "Who would lame that? There was no reason to lame that!"

I hope I do not get banned from #achewood for expressing solidarity with you! It is a risk I am willing to take.

name: tekende
text: I wouldn't mind except that this is just another incident in a weeks-long chain of immature behavior by jollysaintpete which is really beginning to get on my nerves.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: Ramses will beat a man down for foolish laughter, or for the wearing of a childish shirt, but he will not give a substandard food processor to the friends of his estranged son. That is not the way he was raised, and Ray's mother noticed that quality in him when few else did.
Comment left by ______________ ignored.

name: woodenteeth
text: Mods might realise that your logging a bunch of accounts from the same place. I honestly didn't think anyone was paying any attention.

name: irondave
text: The Mods may be watching, but if I were him it is the Rockers I would look out for.

name: tekende
text: It's really the Mockers you have to be wary of.

name: kickstart
text: <3 Ringo

name: comrade_tom
text: I heard those guys knifed Spiffy Geoff under brighton peer, his missus was right gutted...

name: falseprophet
text: The Can Rockers?

name: irondave
text: It turned out to be exactly how I thought it would be.

name: pogo
text: Another "Igor"

name: i_love_kate
text: What do you mean by these comments, man.

name: thorfinn
text: He is old and senile, it's like when your grandpa starts raving on about the Nazis hiding in his clothes hamper, just waiting for the right moment to strike.  Any time pogo says something that doesn't appear to make sense, I just chalk it up to dementia.

name: tekende
text: He's gonna do a urine on himself!

name: pogo
text: A strip or two ago, I said I was going to "igore" one of the new spawn of glyc, then someone made an Al Gore iPod ad, and I said it was actually Igor, then the Franken-STEEN joke.  Why do I remember such trivia?  Because I can!

name: tekende
text: But did you have an onion on your belt? It was the style at the time.

name: zedpower
text: I'd like to see Ramses meet Cornelius. I don't know if they'd even like each other (probably, but then again maybe not), but I'm sure it'd be interesting either way.

name: nbeer
text: I think there would probably be no more communication between the two of them than a barely perceptible nod, and yet within that nod there would be several doctoral theses' worth of nuance and complexity, as well as footnotes and an annotated bibliography, all bound in hand-tooled leather and smelling of billiards.

name: lawbot
text: no.

name: i_love_kate
text: Uncapitalised and featuring punctuation? That's getting off quite lightly, if I'm not mistaken.

name: woodenteeth
text: nuance and complexity in that "no.".

name: dasilodavi
text:
The thing I really like about this strip is that it emonstrates how cohesive the Achewood world is, despite being a very bizarre place. I mean, men come back from the dead to attend weddings, Ray's got Airwolf in his garage, and serial killers bed with gay republicans, but it's all so well established and accepted that we don't even need to bother with explanations.

Two men want a machine that can make bread. Of course. No man is a man what can't make his own staff of life, duh!

name: margargaret
text: I don't think Pat is a Republican.

name: margargaret
text: Although I don't think he has ever expressed him political beliefs in the strip, so I could be wrong. I just don't think veganism goes well with capitalistic republican beliefs.

name: margargaret
text: Gather round friends. I bring you gifts of I-Don't-Know-What-I-Am-Talking-About.

name: irondave
text: I think you swerved into the truth, there.  Pat has a lot of "limousine liberal" ways about him.  Though they have a lot in common with "Country Club Republicans."

name: binlaggin
text:
I always associated Pat's dickishness with left leaning politics taken to the point of idiocy.

I further extrapolate (I think based on an interview that I read) that Pat is how Onstad expresses his own liberal self-loathing. (i.e. he has sympathy for Pat's causes, but is uncomfortable with it, so he satirizes it.)

In other words, is there some evidence I am unaware of that Pat is a reublican?

name: lateadopter
text: His virulent anti-gay stance and his authoritarian leanings.

name: binlaggin
text:
Authoritarian leanings are a flaw shared by extremists at both ends of the spectrum.

Is Pat a self-hating gay? I thought his transition made him a gay activist--"I can't teach school in texas or rent a car in Alabama!"

name: lateadopter
text: I was referring to the time before he found out he was gay.  Now he's conflicted, but still a dick.

name: flazisismuss
text: Pat is a dick.  Most Republicans are dicks.  Ergo, Pat is most Republicans.

name: tekende
text: So, I guess you're a Republican too, then?

name: thorfinn
text: That's a funny thing that you said, because he's bald , so his head looks like a penis, and you called him a dick.  This makes me chortle and even snicker a little bit.

name: flazisismuss
text: I'm a Registered Asshole, but certainly never a Republican.

name: achilleselbow
text: Come now, Tekende, can't you let us enjoy blunt political jabs without reading too much into it and starting one of these cycles? Now flazissismuss is going to post an explanation of why Republicans are dicks. In the midst of doing so he will refer to specific policies, at least one of which someone will take it upon themselves to defend, launching an entire subdiscussion on the subject. Then someone is going to jump in with something like "I thought liberals were supposed to be tolerant of everyone, doesn't that include Republicans?" Then someone else will post their very original thoughts on why all political parties are evil and self-interested and therefore you shouldn't identify with any of them. Interspersed among these comments will be lawbot going "YES" and "NO", but since thread recursion will have long reached its limit by this time, all comments will appear in a solid vertical line and it will be impossible to determine what he is replying to, thus making his comments even more worthless than usual. In a matter of minutes we'll have a 10-page skyscraper of boredom comparable only to the self-absorbed rantings of the multi-account douche, and I will once again be tempted into a self-imposed exile. Which might actually be good for everyone involved, so by all means let's proceed.

name: achilleselbow
text: Anyway, even if all Republicans are dicks (which they are), it does not follow that all dicks are Republicans. For example, I am a dick, but not a Republican.

name: tekende
text:
I guess I just don't find mean-spirited blanket generalizations to be funny? And anyway, it isn't true and comes across as insulting and condescending. Because not all Republicans are dicks (in fact I would think that, like Democrats or any other group of people really, most Republicans are not dicks).

At any rate, if someone had said that all Democrats are dicks, I doubt you'd be so amused and quick to defend the poster.

name: loneal
text: I would change that parenthetical statement to say "like Democrats or any other group of people really, most Republicans are dicks."

name: hedonismbot
text: The more intensely they define themselves by political views, the more completely dick they are.

name: tekende
text: hedonismbot has probably hit a rich vein of Truth here.

name: lawbot
text: yes.

name: tekende
text: So what you're saying is, most people are dicks? I'd disagree, but at least it's fair.

name: tekende
text: Damn non-indentation. The post starting with "So what you're saying" was a reply to loneal.

name: pogo
text: I just want to jump on the dick train.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Rock on, Pogo.

name: woodenteeth
text: pogoing the dick train... ohhhh yeah.

name: thorfinn
text: pogo just wants to jump on the dick  <strike>train</strike>

name: i_love_kate
text: Hilarious!

name: flazisismuss
text: I approve of Achilles' summation of the thread that we didn't just have.  That saved a lot of effort.

name: hedonismbot
text: Oh Flazi, bad logic is bad.  A penis with a beard and glasses should do better than this.

name: flazisismuss
text: I think that particular body part is actually the one least capable of employing formal logic.

name: hedonismbot
text: Pat is the sort of guy that will vote for either party, while simultaneously bitching at everyone within earshot about how much that party sucks.  He is (obviously) socially liberal, but far too Libertarian to not hate Democrats.  He is the guy that only complains about politics.  He would do well posting on this board.

name: binlaggin
text: I went back to read Pat's blog and found a reference to him watching the O'Reilly factor.  I think that H-bot is probably right in that his main passion is getting angry about things.

name: margargaret
text: Feed us some delicious links please.

name: binlaggin
text:
Oh man, I am called upon to use bb code. This summons performance anxiety akin to having to start a fire or fix a flat tire in front on members of the opposite sex.

Here is the link

Failsafe option--It's the Jan. 2006 blog. Always have a backup plan.

name: binlaggin
text: Damn--so close. What did I do wrong?

name: mjfitzge
text: just gotta take the slash off of the end of the url and you're golden

name: binlaggin
text: Thank you. Here I go again: link

name: achilleselbow
text: I'm guessing Pat probably voted for Nader just because he knew how much it would piss people off.

name: i_love_kate
text:
I think it is a common misconception that Pat ever intends to piss people off, no matter how good at it he is. Pat sees himself as the only good and reasonable man in a world full of juvenile idiots.

Come to think of it, Ray is possibly to blame for that.

name: henrythecad
text: I love how you can recognize Ray's dad by how they kind of say the same things. Panel 5 is a classic Ray moment.

name: dammittim
text: I have a hard time imagining a strip with Ramses in it that doesn't rate a 5.

name: greenkoolayd
text: it is a sign of macho-ness AND homosexuality for an adult male to let his emotional barriers down in the company of other adult males.
